name: Amazing Movie Stars 5 Quiz | Celebrities | 25 Questions

questions.text: This actor's alcoholism caught up with him on Christmas Day 1946 and his screen image was very close to his real personality?
questions.explanation:
W.C. Fields

	He died from dropsy, a liver ailment and heart failure. He was the original party pooper as he moaned constantly about Christmas Day.

questions.text: Who was killed on 30th September 1955 while driving his Porsche Spyder along a California highway?
questions.explanation:
James Dean.

	Public sorrow was unequalled since the death of Rudolph Valentino.

questions.text: His final film was with Marilyn Monroe in 'The Misfits' before dying from a heart attack in 1960?
questions.explanation:
Clark Gable.

	His third wife Carole Lombard died in a aircrash in 1942.

questions.text: This former juvenile delinquent left home at 13 to work in a variety of menial jobs and became one of France's foremost stars in the 1980s.
questions.explanation: Gerard Depardieu.

questions.text: He became the highest-paid child star, but quarrels between his father and film-makers over asking 8 million dollars a film led to adult oblivion.
questions.explanation:
Macaulay Culkin.

	Other sources claim he was paid 5 million dollars for 'Home Alone' and 5 per cent of the gross to appear in the sequel.

questions.text: Born Tula Ellice Finklea, this American long-legged dancing star was an eye catching partner for both Fred Astaire and Gene Kelly?
questions.explanation: Cyd Charisse.

questions.text: This Welsh-born leading actor died from a cerebral haemorrhage in 1984?
questions.explanation:
Richard Burton.

	He married Elizabeth Taylor from 1964 to 1974 then again two years later.

questions.text: This small, cloth-capped British comedian who was very fond of too-tight suits was knighted in 2000?
questions.explanation: Norman Wisdom.

questions.text: This nine-times married pocket-sized American star was married to Ava Gardner (1942-43) who was his first wife.
questions.explanation:
Mickey Rooney.

	His autobiographies include 'I.E.'(1965) and 'Life is Too Short' (1991)

questions.text: She was born in Los Angeles in 1926 and had a paranoid schizophrenic mother, no permanent father and several foster homes?
questions.explanation:
Marilyn Monroe.

	To this day collectors avidly acquire everything that is written and published about her.

questions.text: This British actress featured in TV's 'The Avengers' (1962-64) as a leather-clad, judo-throwing wildcat. She starred in a 1964 Bond film?
questions.explanation:
Honor Blackman.

	The bond film was 'Goldfinger'. She also starred in TV's 'The Upper Hand' (1990-93).

questions.text: Which actor died of a ruptured appendix in 1926 at the age of 31?
questions.explanation:
Rudolph Valentino.

	He was the great romantic idol of the 1920's and his sudden death caused several suicides and his funeral was a national event.

questions.text: Which American teenage star was named after her home town in Minnesota?
questions.explanation:
Winona Ryder.

	Ryder was born in Winona, Minnesota, on October 29, 1971.

questions.text: This short American actor and former child model was selected to play the hobbit hero in Tolkien's 'Lord of the Rings'?
questions.explanation:
Elijah Wood.

	It has been generally acknowledged that he was Hollywood's best child actor of the 1990s.

questions.text: This British actress died after breaking a hip in a fall. She was created Dame in 1967 and played a glorious Miss Marple?
questions.explanation:
Margaret Rutherford.

	She married Stringer Davis who starred with her in 'Murder Most Foul' (1962) and 'Murder Ahoy' (1964).

questions.text: Name the British actress who married and divorced Peter Vaughan and starred in the film 'The Krays' (1990)?
questions.explanation: Billie Whitelaw.

questions.text: This actress was best known for her role of Estelle in 'Great Expectations'. Her husbands include Stewart Granger and film director Richard Brooks of 'Cat on a Hot Tin Roof' (1958) and 'Elmer Gantry' (1960)?
questions.explanation: Jean Simmons.

questions.text: This actress was no dumb blonde as she wrote her own scripts and proved herself to be an expert self publicist and business woman. She died at the age of 88 in 1980?
questions.explanation:
Mae West.

	One of her autobiographies was 'Goodness Had Nothing To Do With It' (1959).

questions.text: This Scottish born actor was bald from an early age and died from cancer at the age of 75?
questions.explanation:
Alastair Sim.

	Alastair Sim (1900-1976) b. Edinburgh, Scotland.

questions.text: Name the British actor who married Virginia McKenna (1957-94) appearing in several wildlife movies together?
questions.explanation:
Bill Travers.

	They starred in 'Ring of Bright Water' (1969). Virginia McKenna was married to Denholm Elliott (1954-56)

questions.text: This American actor abandoned a baseball career because of a knee injury. He married actress Sarah Jessica Parker in 1997 who had a success with the TV series 'Sex and the City'.
questions.explanation: Matthew Broderick.

questions.text: He was married to his first wife for 30 years when she died. He recovered from a stroke in 1981 and an operation to remove his larynx in 1990. He died from pneumonia in 1994?
questions.explanation:
Joseph Cotten.

	His 1987 autobiography was 'Vanity Will Get You Somewhere'

questions.text: Which dark haired Spanish actress trained as a dancer in classical Spanish ballet and started acting in films at the age of 17?
questions.explanation:
Penelope Cruz.

	She starred in 'Captain Corelli's Mandolin' and a one time girlfriend of Tom Cruise.

questions.text: This Scottish actor was once an electrician. He achieved fame by his role of Simon Callow's partner in 'Four Weddings and a Funeral'?
questions.explanation:
John Hannah.

	He is a leading character called Jonathan in 'The Mummy' (1999) and played Matthew in 'Four Weddings and a Funeral' (1993).

questions.text: This British actor with an upper class air was nicknamed 'The Thinking Woman's Crumpet' and starred in a couple of Bond Movies?
questions.explanation:
Charles Dance.

	He starred in 'The Spy who Loved Me' (1977) and 'For Your Eyes Only' (1981).
